alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Brunswick; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Nottoway (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 8:28PM EST until January 09 at 10:15PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN AMELIA, SOUTH CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD, NORTHERN BRUNSWICK, DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHEASTERN NOTTOWAY COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS AND THE WESTERN CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 828 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Additionally, there have been several reports of closed roads due to high water just west of Petersburg. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Colonial Heights, Lawrenceville, McKenney, Virginia State University, Alberta, Dewitt, Sutherland, Fort Barfoot, Matoaca, Ettrick, Rocky Run, Butterworth, Ford, Center Star, Walkers, Darvills, Rawlings and Hebron. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Brunswick; Chesterfield; City of Colonial Heights; City of Petersburg; Dinwiddie; Nottoway
